==install Java SDK 6==
   $ sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jdk
   
 
==install libpyhdfs==
  $ svn co http://libpyhdfs.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ libpyhdfs

  $ cd libpyhdfs/lib

  $ wget http://libpyhdfs.googlecode.com/files/commons-logging-1.0.4.jar

  $ wget http://libpyhdfs.googlecode.com/files/hadoop-0.20.1-core.jar

  $ wget http://libpyhdfs.googlecode.com/files/libhdfs.so.0

  $ ln -s libhdfs.so.0 libhdfs.so
  
  $ cd ..

  $ sudo python setup.py install --prefix="/usr/local"


-----

You can run `install.sh' to do all the things above.


==Run test script==
   $ cd test

   $ python pyhdfs_test.py


----

If you see the following error:

/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/include/jni.h:27:20: error: jni_md.h: No such file or directory

Edit /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/include/jni.h

change  - 27 #include "jni_md.h"

into    + 27 #include "linux/jni_md.h"

see https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/sun-java6/+bug/390290

Debian has the same problem.

----
On Ubuntu 9.04 + python2.6, you need to add "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/site-packages" to sys.path, 

see https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python2.6/+bug/362570
